intro: Palicourea perquadrangularis var. pubens, commonly known as the pubescent palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a pubescent surface. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
